item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Saturday, March 8, 2025 at 8:10 PM UTC
item.description:
1. Kill your Feeds – Stop letting algorithms dictate what you think (281 points | 109 comments)
2. AI tools are spotting errors in research papers: inside a growing movement (275 points | 112 comments)
3. Deploy from local to production (self-hosted) (19 points | 3 comments)
4. Discovering Errors in Donald Knuth's Taocp (76 points | 17 comments)
5. Google will still have to break up its business, the Justice Department said (85 points | 23 comments)
6. The program is the database is the interface (99 points | 29 comments)
7. Kagi Is Bringing Orion Web Browser to Linux (99 points | 38 comments)
8. Discworld Rules (127 points | 144 comments)

12. Spice Data (YC S19) Is Hiring a Founding Senior/Staff Software Engineer ( | hide)

22. Undocumented backdoor found in Bluetooth chip used by a billion devices (234 points | 67 comments)
23. Introducing command And commandfor In HTML (400 points | 229 comments)
24. "Wooly mice" a test run for mammoth gene editing (53 points | 44 comments)
25. Sam Bankman-Fried thrown into solitary over Tucker Carlson interview: report (126 points | 134 comments)
26. Forces deep underground seem to be deforming Earth's inner core (42 points | 18 comments)
27. Mountains, Cliffs, and Caves: A Guide to Using Perlin Noise for Procedural Gen (153 points | 29 comments)
28. How Much Are LLMs Boosting Real-World Programmer Productivity? (13 points | 6 comments)
29. Cat-Eared Robots Are Waiting Tables in Japan's Restaurants (32 points | 34 comments)
30. Ask HN: Do your eyes bug you even though your prescription is "correct"? (302 points | 284 comments)
